abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Barbara Sheehan's murder trial, which ended with her acquittal; asserts that the case should have been settled with a plea bargain to avoid the emotional turmoil that comes with a long trial.
snippet: A plea bargain in the case of Barbara Sheehan, the Queens woman charged with killing her abusive husband, would have averted the emotional toll the trial took on the victims of his abuse.
lead_paragraph: A plea bargain in the case of Barbara Sheehan, the Queens woman charged with killing her abusive husband, would have averted the emotional toll the trial took on the victims of his abuse.

headline.main: A Killing Better Kept Out of Court
headline.print_headline: A Killing Better Kept Out of Court
headline.seo: Barbara Sheehan Case Shouldn’t Have Gone to Trial
